revised_title: The Blood-Proper and Chylaqueous Fluids in Invertebrate Animals
tldr: The author examines the blood and chylaqueous fluids in invertebrate animals, discovering two distinct nutritious fluids with different anatomical relations and chemical compositions. They observe a gradation in these fluids and their containing systems in the animal series, which helps explain digestion, sanguification, and respiration processes in invertebrates. This research also suggests new ways to understand the circulation and nutrient fluids in lower classes of invertebrate animals.
